title: Bug 7785: SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: Bug 7785: SaveAs Forgets the file type. The icon has also changed from the parent java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Modify it (e.g., move an existing class).
3) Click the SaveAs icon next to the Save Icon.
A dialog will appear.
4) Browse for a valid container location.
5) Type the filename but ignore the extension, which isn't requested.
6) Click Ok.
Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location but with no file extension shown.
EB:
The file is now treated as a generic file. Opening it will show the file content as text.

Expected Behavior:
The file should be saved with the same extension as the original file, unless explicitly changed.
SR:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Make a modification to the file (e.g., move an existing class).
3) Click on the SaveAs icon located next to the Save Icon.
4) A dialog window should appear.
5) Browse for a valid container location to save the file.
6) Type a filename without specifying the extension.
7) Click the Ok button.
8) Verify that the file is saved with the original file extension, unless explicitly changed.
